title: Apple chancery except...
content:
This is Apple Chancery but is there a chancery or similar that has the capital M have the same upper right curl as the capital N shown? I have had some baseball caps embroided on a machine which had a typeface just like this one but for that slight difference.  
TIA

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [MNT.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20061124224811/http:/typophile.com/files/MNT.jpg) | 31.46 KB |
author: byngo

comments.content: Did you try [Poetica 1](http://web.archive.org/web/20061124224811/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=7&displayfontid=C.6309.0.0&fontRendererText=MNT) or [Poetica 2](http://web.archive.org/web/20061124224811/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=14&displayfontid=C.6310.0.0&fontRendererText=MNT)? Not the same as your sample, but quite interesting, I think.
thanks for your help, I did look at zapf chancery but I don’t think it’s close enough, being picky though. Might just end up fiddling the M

It might be easier to show us a picture of the baseball cap.

- Lex
